translation.en: What were you before the white man named you a Negro?
What was your name? It couldn't have been Smith or Jones.
They don't have those kind of names
translation.ko: 우리 고향에선 그런 이름 안 씁니다

translation.en: where you and I came from.
translation.ko: 우리 고향에선 그런 이름 안 씁니다 맞아요

translation.en: [Herb Boyd] Malcolm spoke truth to power.
This guy is fearless.
It's the white man that's cracking skulls!
[Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] But even at the height of his popularity,
he had a lot of enemies.
[Malcolm X] I do believe there will be attempts on my life.
They're foaming at the mouth.
[Amin Nathari] It was inevitable that he'd be killed.
I probably am a dead man already.
-[witness 1] Shooting like a cowboy. -[witness 2] People crawling on the floor.
translation.ko: 카우보이처럼 쐈어요 다들 바닥을 기고 있었어요

translation.en: [Calvin Sinnette] It was like warfare.
[Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] The first time I saw those bullet wounds,
translation.ko: 그 총상을 처음 봤을 때 생각했죠

translation.en: I thought, "Why doesn't someone want to get to the bottom of this?"
translation.ko: '왜 아무도 이 사건을 파헤치지 않는 거지?'

translation.en: So I started asking questions. It became an obsession.
translation.ko: 그래서 여기저기 묻기 시작했어요 갈수록 집착하게 됐죠

translation.en: [reporter] Who do you believe is responsible for Malcolm X's death?
The white power structure in America is behind it.
[James Farmer] He said that he was going to be killed because he knew too much.
translation.ko: 자신이 너무 많은 걸 알기 때문에 살해당할 거라고 했습니다

translation.en: What did he know?
[James Shabazz] Might be an inside job.
[Tony Bouza] The investigation was a failure from beginning to end.
[Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] Three men were arrested.
[Aziz] The white man say you guilty, you guilty. Why? Because he says so and he got a gun.
translation.ko: 백인이 유죄라면 그런 거예요 총 들고 유죄라고 하니까요

translation.en: [officer] Has he signed a statement?
The thing is, two of them weren't even in the Audubon Ballroom that day.
translation.ko: 문제는 그중 2명이 그날 오듀본 볼룸에 가지도 않았단 거죠

translation.en: Malcolm's death never sat right with me.
This is a rough hood.
What we're doing, it makes me nervous.
translation.ko: 우리가 지금 하는 일 때문에 불안하네요

translation.en: [David Garrow] Asking who's guilty of Malcolm's assassination
is a dangerous question to ask.
That's not something that we talked about.
Leave it alone.
What is the real story? You know who did it.
translation.ko: - 그냥 덮어요 - 진실은 뭐죠? 범인 아시잖아요

translation.en: It's important to get answers about who gunned down my father.
translation.ko: 누가 내 아버지를 총으로 쐈는지 알아내는 건 중요해요

translation.en: ...by any means necessary!
This is still a unsolved case, a mystery.
That's almost too much to process.
[Al Sharpton] He was our shining black prince.
People still don't get it.
[Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] The whole thing is on film!
Wow. I was not aware of that.
I'm not a lawyer, I don't have a Ph.D. Who did this?
translation.ko: 난 변호사도 박사도 아녜요 누가 한 짓일까요?

translation.en: Folks try to caution me. "You leave that alone, man."
translation.ko: 다들 경고해요 - '그 사건은 묻어 둬라' - 죽은 사람 일은 왜 캐요?

translation.en: Why would we dig up the dead?
translation.ko: - '그 사건은 묻어 둬라' - 죽은 사람 일은 왜 캐요?

translation.en: [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] The more people tell me I can't do something,
translation.ko: 하면 안 된다고 말하는 사람이 늘어날수록

translation.en: that's the thing I want to do.
I'm not going to stop until I get justice.
translation.ko: 정의를 만날 때까진 포기 안 해요

translation.en: Because the official account of who killed Malcolm X...
translation.ko: 누가 맬컴 X를 죽였는가에 대한 공식적인 설명은

translation.en: it's not true.
[host] My guest tonight, Malcolm X,
once the number-two man in the Black Muslims,
now broken with Elijah Muhammad.
He says he's a marked man and that a number of attempts have been made on his life.
translation.ko: 자신이 표적이 되었으며 암살 시도가 많았다고 합니다

translation.en: [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] Malcolm knew he was going to die by someone's hands.
translation.ko: 맬컴은 자신이 누군가의 손에 죽게 될 것을 알았어요

translation.en: It was coming.
He was predicting it, even.
Malcolm spent the night of February 20, 1965,
in the Hilton Hotel.
He had a big rally the next day.
translation.ko: 다음 날 큰 집회를 할 예정이었죠

translation.en: He wanted to find a safe place that no one knew where he was staying,
translation.ko: 아무도 자신이 어디 묵는지 모를 안전한 곳을 찾으려 했어요

translation.en: so he could collect his thoughts.
He was awakened by a phone call in the morning.
And the person on the other end of the line
said something that let him know that someone knew where he was at.
translation.ko: 맬컴이 거기 있다는 걸 다 안다는 뜻이었어요

translation.en: That he could be gotten anywhere, essentially.
translation.ko: 그러니 어디서든 죽을 수 있다는 거였죠

translation.en: He called his wife, Betty, he said, "I want you to come and I want you to bring the girls,"
translation.ko: 즉시 아내 베티에게 전화해서 딸들과 함께 오라고 말했죠

translation.en: and that's what she did.
[Sinnette] My wife was pleased that it was a clear, bright Sunday morning.
translation.ko: 맑고 화창한 일요일 아침이라서 아내가 기뻐했었죠

translation.en: When we walked into the ballroom,
we sat about eight to ten rows from the stage.
I could see Betty
translation.ko: 주위를 둘러보니 맬컴의 아내 베티가 보였죠

translation.en: and I think one or more of her children with her.
translation.ko: 맬컴의 아내 베티가 보였죠 "캘빈 시넷 목격자" 옆에 애도 한두 명 있더라고요

translation.en: [A. Peter Bailey] I got there a little bit early.
And when brother Malcolm came in,
it was the first time I'd ever seen him where he'd looked a little harried.
As though the pressures were getting on him.
[Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] He knew at that point
that time was running out for him.
All the signs were there,
and that's why none of his invited speakers
translation.ko: 그래서 그날 그와 함께 무대에 오를 예정이었던

translation.en: that were supposed to appear on that stage with him that day, none of them showed up.
translation.ko: 초대 연설자들도 단 한 명도 나타나지 않았죠

translation.en: Everyone knew that this man was in trouble. This man was hot!
translation.ko: 이 사람이 곤경에 처했고 화제의 인물임을 다들 안 거예요

translation.en: [Bailey] I remember him saying, "The way I feel today, I shouldn't even be here."
translation.ko: 이렇게 말하더군요, '오늘은 진짜 여기 있으면 안 된단 예감이 들어'

translation.en: And myself and about four of us people backstage, we said,
translation.ko: 그래서 저랑 무대 뒤에 있던 4명 정도가 말했죠

translation.en: "Well, why don't you go home? People will understand."
"You know, you've been under a lot of pressure over the last three weeks."
And he said, "No, they want to hear me,
what I have to say about the firebombing."
[Malcolm X] As many of you know, Sunday morning about three o'clock,
somebody threw some bombs inside my house.
I'm telling you these things, because it has reached
translation.ko: 이런 걸 말씀드리는 건 지금 시점에서는

translation.en: a point where I feel that black people
translation.ko: 이런 걸 말씀드리는 건 지금 시점에서는 이 나라의 흑인들도 무슨 일이 벌어지는지

translation.en: in this country need to know what's going on.
translation.ko: 이 나라의 흑인들도 무슨 일이 벌어지는지 알아야 한다고 생각하기 때문입니다

translation.en: And I'm talking about an organization
which I had a hand in building, which I had a hand in organizing.
translation.ko: 설립과 운영 과정에 저도 직접 참여했습니다

translation.en: [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] By the time he left the Nation of Islam,
Malcolm had a lot of enemies.
The Nation of Islam was a pure dictatorship.
translation.ko: 네이션 오브 이슬람은 완전히 독재나 다름없었죠

translation.en: Elijah Muhammad was at the top.
And Malcolm was seen as a traitor,
because he had turned on his leader
who had raised him up from a common criminal
translation.ko: 일개 범죄자였던 맬컴을 수렁에서 건져 내어

translation.en: and put him on a pinnacle before the world.
translation.ko: 세상의 정점에 올려 준 사람에게 말이죠

translation.en: Also the federal government, the FBI,
was deathly afraid of someone like Malcolm X.
translation.ko: 티는 안 냈지만 맬컴 X 같은 사람을 두려워했죠

translation.en: And one of the most perplexing details about this story
translation.ko: 그리고 이 이야기에서 가장 황당한 부분은

translation.en: is the fact that there was an absence of any kind of police force
in and around the Audubon that afternoon.
This was very strange,
especially given the recent threats
translation.ko: 굉장히 이상한 거예요, 특히나 당시 맬컴이 살해 협박에 시달린 걸 고려하면요

translation.en: that were made on his life.
translation.ko: 당시 맬컴이 살해 협박에 시달린 걸 고려하면요

translation.en: [Zaheer Ali] Usually at the rallies at the Audubon Ballroom,
there'd be up to two dozen police officers stationed outside.
And on that day, there were only two uniformed officers,
and they're stationed upstairs inside, away from the ballroom.
translation.ko: 그것도 볼룸과 거리가 있는 위층에 있었고요

translation.en: So the deterrent effect of having law enforcement present was not there.
translation.ko: 따라서 경찰력이 있을 때의 억제 효과가 없었던 거죠

translation.en: [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] It kind of gave a kind of menacing vibe to the whole scene.
You know... where was this police presence?
[reporter] Try to remember just exactly what happened.
translation.ko: 정확히 무슨 일이 있었는지 말씀해 주시죠

translation.en: [witness 1] Well, he had just got up to open up.
And, um, he was speaking. I don't remember the exact words he was saying...
translation.ko: 뭐라고 연설을 했는데 정확하게는 기억 안 나요

translation.en: Malcolm goes to the rostrum, and he gave the greeting.
Salaam-alaikum.
[Gene Simpson] At that point, a rumbling broke out behind us.
[man] Get your hand out of my pocket!
[Gene Simpson] And everybody in the place naturally turned around to look.
translation.ko: 곧 그 장소의 모든 사람들이 자연스럽게 돌아보았습니다

translation.en: [Samuel Bilal] I remember Malcolm was raising
his hand saying, "All right, everybody be cool now."
translation.ko: 맬컴은 손을 들고 이렇게 말했죠 '다들 진정하십시오'였나? 뭐, 비슷한 말이었어요

translation.en: Or something to that effect.
I said to myself, "Why don't they cut that out?
translation.ko: 전 속으로 생각했죠 '왜 저렇게 웅성거리는 거야? 빨리 맬컴 연설 듣고 싶은데'

translation.en: I want to hear Malcolm unfold this program."
translation.ko: '왜 저렇게 웅성거리는 거야? 빨리 맬컴 연설 듣고 싶은데'

translation.en: [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] And a burly, dark-skinned man walked up to the stage
translation.ko: 그때 건장한 검은 피부의 남자가 무대로 올라가서

translation.en: and pulled from under his coat a sawed-off shotgun.
translation.ko: 총신을 짧게 자른 산탄총을 외투 안에서 꺼냈어요

translation.en: And, uh, just then the gunfire went off.
[Bilal] Next thing I know, two other fellas jumped up.
They're shooting this place up.
I remember there were so many shots that were fired.
It was like warfare.
[Betty Shabazz] I saw people crawling on the floor.
So I got down too.
And my children were crying, you know, "What's going on, what's going on? Are they gonna shoot us?"
translation.ko: 애들은 울면서 소리쳤죠 '무슨 일이죠? 우릴 쏘는 거예요?'

translation.en: [Shabazz] Then I saw, um, someone
look in amazement to the front. I knew they had shot my husband.
translation.ko: 놀란 표정으로 앞을 보고 있더군요 남편이 맞았음을 직감했죠

translation.en: [Bailey] I ran down and I jumped up on the stage.
And his shirt was open and I saw all these bullet holes in his body.
And he was gasping.
I remember thinking to myself, "He's gonna die. He's gonna die."
[Shabazz] My husband was all I had. I mean, he was...
He was everything to me and my children.
He said that, uh... That he'd always love me and provide for us.
translation.ko: 평생 저만 사랑하고 가족을 부양할 거라고 했었어요

translation.en: [Malcolm X] We're not brutalized because we're Muslims.
translation.ko: 우린 이슬람교도라서 짐승 취급을 받는 게 아닙니다

translation.en: We're not brutalized because we're Catholics.
translation.ko: 가톨릭 신자라서 짐승 취급을 받는 것도 아니죠

translation.en: We're brutalized because we are black people in America.
translation.ko: 미국의 흑인이라서 짐승 취급을 받는 겁니다

translation.en: [Jelani Cobb] If you're looking at the genealogy of the anger and activism in this country,
we see lots of it descending from Malcolm.
[Malcolm X] If they want us to turn the other cheek,
teach white people to turn the other cheek.
And if they want us to love our enemy,
teach white people to love their enemy.
[Cobb] Malcolm was the primary articulator
translation.ko: 맬컴은 미국에 맞서는 흑인들의 대의와 주장을

translation.en: of our cause and our case against America,
translation.ko: 맬컴은 미국에 맞서는 흑인들의 대의와 주장을 대변하는 사람이었죠

translation.en: against white supremacy in the United States.
[Malcolm X] Black people in this country have been the victims
of violence at the hands of the white man for 400 years.
Is that different 53 years after his death?
translation.ko: 그가 떠난 지 53년이 지났는데 달라졌냐고요? "젤러니 코브 '뉴요커'지 전속 기자"

translation.en: Not really.
-[Eric Garner] I can't breathe! -[cop] Put your hands behind your back!
translation.ko: - 숨을 못 쉬겠어요 - 머리 뒤로 손 올려

translation.en: -[Eric Garner] I can't breathe! -[Malcolm X] When someone attacks you,
when someone comes at you with a club, with a gun,
translation.ko: 누군가 날 공격하고 곤봉과 총을 들고 달려들 때조차

translation.en: despite the fact that you've done nothing wrong,
he tells you, "Suffer peacefully."
And how long can you suffer, after suffering for 400 years?
We declare our right to be respected as a human being,
to be given the rights of a human being,
which we intend to bring into existence by any means necessary.
translation.ko: 그걸 우리는 실현하려는 것입니다 무슨 수를 써서라도!

translation.en: [Cobb] For those who love Malcolm,
it is a really, really intense relationship with his memory.
[Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] Malcolm spoke to me at a time
translation.ko: 전 굉장히 성난 젊은이였을 때 맬컴의 연설을 들었죠

translation.en: when I was a very angry young man, and I fell in love with him.
translation.ko: 전 굉장히 성난 젊은이였을 때 맬컴의 연설을 들었죠 그리고 바로 반했어요

translation.en: I was the victim of a police attack
translation.ko: 난 겨우 14살 때 경찰한테 폭행을 당했었죠

translation.en: when I was only 14 years old, and it was racially motivated.
translation.ko: 난 겨우 14살 때 경찰한테 폭행을 당했었죠 내 인종 때문이었어요

translation.en: One quiet Sunday afternoon, myself and my cousin,
translation.ko: 어느 조용하던 일요일 오후 사촌 형과 함께 있을 때였죠

translation.en: I believe I was in 9th grade,
and we were just hanging out on our bikes.
Me, him, and his girlfriend,
translation.ko: 저, 사촌 형, 형 여자 친구 셋이서요

translation.en: a young white girl.
I was just chatting with the young lady,
and this, evidently, enraged the police.
translation.ko: 경찰은 굉장히 많이 싫었던 게 분명해요

translation.en: You know, "How dare these black boys date these white girls?"
translation.ko: 어떻게 흑인 녀석들이 백인 여자랑 데이트하냐 이런 거죠

translation.en: They did a fishtail, you know, "whoop-whoop,"
you know, jumped out the car.
They grabbed me by my afro, and they said, you know,
translation.ko: 제 아프로 머리를 움켜쥐었어요 이렇게 말하더군요 '백인 여자 만나고 싶냐, 깜둥아?'

translation.en: "You like dating white girls, nigger?
translation.ko: 이렇게 말하더군요 '백인 여자 만나고 싶냐, 깜둥아?'

translation.en: That's what you like to do?"
And they flung me against the car
and one of 'em came up and gave me a nice knee, y'know?
I'm 14 years old!
They threw me in the back of the car,
and then they just drove around Providence and terrorized me.
They started talking about how many brothers
they threw in the Providence River.
translation.ko: 몇 명인 줄 아느냐는 얘길 했어요

translation.en: "You remember Pookie? You remember Ray-Ray, or Johnny?
translation.ko: '너 푸키 기억하지? 레이레이는?' '조니는? 어떻게 된 줄 알지?'

translation.en: Y'know what happened to them, didn't you?
They're at the bottom of the Providence River." That kind of talk.
Then one officer looked to the other officer and he said,
translation.ko: 그런 뒤 한 명이 다른 한 명을 보며 말했어요

translation.en: "Did he say something? Did you say something, boy?
Say one more thing and we'll split your head like a goddamn grape, okay?"
translation.ko: '한 번만 더 입 열어 봐 포도알처럼 머릴 으깨 줄 테니'

translation.en: I remembered there was a...
a paralyzing fear just trying to figure out
translation.ko: 무력감을 느꼈던 기억이 나요 앞으로 어떻게 될 것인가만 생각했죠

translation.en: what was going to become of me, y'know?
What are these guys gonna do?
All I could do was just sit there, you know,
translation.ko: 내가 할 수 있는 건 그냥 가만히 앉아서

translation.en: and accept whatever my fate was going to be, you know?
Um... It was terrifying. It was terrifying.
Every case of police brutality against a Negro follows the same pattern.
translation.ko: 흑인을 상대로 하는 경찰 폭행 사건은 전부 패턴이 똑같습니다

translation.en: -[man] You right! -They attack you, bust you all upside your mouth,
translation.ko: 경찰이 먼저 공격해서 말도 못 하게 두들겨 팬 뒤

translation.en: and then take you to court and charge you with assault.
What kind of democracy is that? [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] The first time I heard his voice,
translation.ko: - 그게 무슨 민주주의입니까? - 목소리를 처음 듣자마자

translation.en: what really attracted me to it was the fearlessness of it.
translation.ko: 정말로 반할 수밖에 없었죠 두려움이라고는 없었거든요

translation.en: [Malcolm X] You speak as a black man, a black man whose patience has run out.
translation.ko: 흑인으로 당당히 외치십시오 우린 인내심이 바닥난 흑인입니다

translation.en: The manhood in it!
The day of the sit-in, the crawl-in,
the cry-in, and the beg-in is outdated.
The power of this man's courage to say this stuff.
translation.ko: 그런 말을 할 용기를 가진 사람의 힘은

translation.en: You know, it was... It was irresistible!
It changed the entire trajectory of my life.
translation.ko: 내 인생 궤도는 그때 완전히 바뀌었죠

translation.en: That's the reason why I went to Howard University.
That's the reason I became a black militant activist at that moment.
translation.ko: 맬컴 때문에 당시 흑인 급진주의 투사로 활동했어요

translation.en: We all had a story or know someone who's been jacked up by the police.
translation.ko: 누구나 경찰에 직접 당해 봤거나 당한 사람을 알고 있었죠

translation.en: And that's what Malcolm represented for us.
You know, that black man that wasn't gonna take this shit anymore.
translation.ko: 더는 이런 불합리를 감내하지 않겠다는 흑인이었죠

translation.en: Malcolm's death never sat right with me.
There were too many unanswered questions.
And for the better part of 30 years,
I've dedicated my life to understanding this story.
I'm not a lawyer. I don't have a Ph.D. I don't have a Master's.
translation.ko: 난 변호사도 박사도 아녜요 석사 학위도 없죠

translation.en: I'm not what you would call, even, a professional.
I have no shame about that.
Just a regular brother who felt that Malcolm deserved justice.
translation.ko: 그냥 맬컴한테 정의를 찾아 줘야 한다고 생각하는 평범한 형제죠

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen, my name is Abdur-Rahman,
I'll be your narrator. This portion of the tour,
on behalf of Arlington National Cemetery Tours,
I'd like to welcome you all to Arlington National Cemetery.
This is our nation's most sacred place of remembrance...
translation.ko: 이곳은 우리 나라에서 가장 신성한 추모 장소이자...

translation.en: [David Garrow] Abdur-Rahman Muhammad is without question
the most knowledgeable person about Malcolm's murder.
translation.ko: 맬컴의 암살에 대해 가장 아는 것이 많은 사람이에요 "데이비드 개로 역사학자, 퓰리처상 수상"

translation.en: He's been an independent researcher
working on this for a good number of years now.
translation.ko: 독자적으로 이걸 조사한 지 상당히 오래됐죠

translation.en: [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] Look to the driver's side, the large memorial there in the center of the...
translation.ko: 운전기사 쪽으로 보이는 저 큰 기념비는...

translation.en: [Garrow] He has invested hundreds of hours
tracking down direct first-hand evidence
of the conspiracy to kill Malcolm X.
...brutally assassinated in June of 1963.
translation.ko: - 직접적 증거를 추적했죠 - 1963년에 잔혹하게 암살된... 맬컴의 죽음을 밝히기 위해 누구보다도 많은 일을 한 사람이

translation.en: [Garrow] No one alive has done more
translation.ko: 맬컴의 죽음을 밝히기 위해 누구보다도 많은 일을 한 사람이

translation.en: to solve Malcolm's killing than Abdur-Rahman Muhammad.
translation.ko: 맬컴의 죽음을 밝히기 위해 누구보다도 많은 일을 한 사람이 압두르라흐만 무함마드예요

translation.en: ...state of Mississippi to become the first field secretary
translation.ko: 당시 고향인 미시시피주에서 NAACP의 지도자로 활동하고 있었습니다

translation.en: for the NAACP at that time.
[Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] Early on, I had read enough to think that the case was a sham, all right?
translation.ko: 자료를 많이 읽고 애초에 이 사건이 거짓임을 확신했죠

translation.en: That it was a fraud.
I had read enough to believe that the killers were still out there.
translation.ko: 진범은 여전히 활개 치고 다닌다고 믿게 됐죠

translation.en: It's been a great honor and privilege
to share this rich and auspicious history with you.
Never been afraid of the truth.
I always wanted to know, what is the real story?
translation.ko: 늘 알고 싶었죠 진실이 뭐든 간에 감내할 겁니다

translation.en: Whatever it is, I'll deal with it.
I decided that, you know, if it was ever possible
translation.ko: 그래서 결심했죠 진범을 찾아내는 게 가능하다면 찾아내겠다고요

translation.en: for me to find these people, that I would find them.
I mean, this is Malcolm X we're talking about!
[Herbert J. Stern] It was a Sunday. I had the homicide duty.
Usually, there wasn't much homicide activity, you know,
translation.ko: 보통 살인 사건은 별로 없었죠 "허버트 스턴 전 뉴욕 검사"

translation.en: certainly not in the afternoons.
I was in a bar, dancing.
And you know, the dancing in those days was a lot of leaping in the air.
I remember the name of the place too, it was called Ondine's.
It doesn't exist anymore.
translation.ko: 지금은 없어졌어요 그 술집이 있던 곳이 57번가

translation.en: It was on, I think, 57th Street right under the bridge.
translation.ko: 지금은 없어졌어요 그 술집이 있던 곳이 57번가 딱 다리 밑이었죠

translation.en: I heard somebody say, "You hear? Malcolm X was shot."
In this whole bar, there was one booth with a telephone,
translation.ko: 술집이 그렇게 큰데 공중전화는 딱 한 대였어요

translation.en: and it was occupied.
But I had a badge, you know.
So I took my badge out, and I went over to the booth, I knocked on the thing.
translation.ko: 그래서 그걸 꺼낸 뒤 부스로 가서 문을 두들겼죠

translation.en: Guy looked up, and I said... Showed him the badge. "Out!"
And I called Manhattan North Homicide.
They said, "Mr. Stern, where have you been? We have been looking for you."
translation.ko: 이러더군요, '스턴 검사님 어디세요? 다들 찾고 있는데'

translation.en: [reporter] Chief, could you describe what happened here today?
[police chief] At about 3:15 p.m. this afternoon,
there were about 400 persons present in the ballroom here,
translation.ko: 오늘 오후 약 3시 15분경 이 볼룸에는 400명 정도가 모여 있었습니다

translation.en: representing an organization headed up by Malcolm X.
[reporter] There were no police at this meeting, were there, Inspector?
There were no uniformed policemen assigned inside this ballroom.
translation.ko: 이 볼룸 안에 배치한 정복 경찰은 없었습니다

translation.en: [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] When the police arrived at the Audubon,
there was no sense of urgency.
And this was noticed by a lot of people.
Almost as if they knew this was going to happen.
translation.ko: 마치 이렇게 될 줄 알았다는 분위기였어요

translation.en: Almost as if they wanted it to happen.
translation.ko: 꼭 이렇게 되길 바란 것만 같았죠

translation.en: [Bailey] The police, they looked so nonchalant.
It just really... It angered me when I saw it.
They was just strolling through the Audubon Ballroom
like they was on a Sunday stroll in Central Park.
translation.ko: 일요일에 센트럴파크 산책을 나온 것 같았어요

translation.en: And people were on the floor, chairs overturned,
translation.ko: 사람들은 바닥에 누워 있고 의자는 나동그라지고

translation.en: people were still crying and screaming.
translation.ko: 다들 여전히 울고 비명을 지르는 데 말이죠

translation.en: [Stern] The crime scene was a total mess.
The whole place was in total disarray.
There was nothing to see at the scene that would have helped me as a lawyer on the case.
translation.ko: 사건 담당 검사로서 둘러봐도 도움될 게 없었어요

translation.en: We knew that Malcolm had stood up in front of a very crowded ballroom
translation.ko: 맬컴은 굉장히 혼잡한 볼룸 앞쪽에 서 있었죠

translation.en: and that the shooters massacred him
in the presence of his family.
Boom, boom, boom, boom. They just blew him apart.
[police chief] We have found one weapon at the scene.
A shotgun, which, I'm sorry, I cannot describe for--
translation.ko: 산탄총인데 죄송하지만 더는 얘기할 수 없습니다

translation.en: -[reporter] A sawed-off shotgun? -Sawed-off shotgun.
[Stern] Actually, we knew that there were three kinds of weapons.
translation.ko: 사실 쓰인 총이 3가지란 건 알고 있었죠

translation.en: There was a shotgun.
There was a .45,
and then there was some sort of... like a Luger.
[reporter] Where was Malcolm hit?
He sustained one shot in the lower right chin
and the others hit him in the chest and, uh, body.
[Stern] We knew that one of the shooters,
one carrying a .45, had run,
and was shot by one of Malcolm's bodyguards.
He managed to stagger into the street
and then the mob tried to kill him.
[Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] By then, the police had finally arrived
and they rescued him from almost certain death.
He was immediately arrested, and he was found with a weapon.
translation.ko: 즉시 체포됐죠 현장에서 총을 든 채 발견됐으니

translation.en: So, that was kind of, "Case closed" for him.
What bothers me the most
translation.ko: "털매지 헤이어 일명 토머스 헤이건" 가장 괴로운 건 나머지 2명이 도망갔단 거예요

translation.en: is that the other gunmen got away
translation.ko: 가장 괴로운 건 나머지 2명이 도망갔단 거예요

translation.en: because there was no police.
Were it not for the fact that one of Malcolm's security detail
translation.ko: 맬컴의 경호원이 그놈의 다리를 쐈으니 망정이지

translation.en: shot this man in the leg,
all of the assassins would've got away.
[Zaheer Ali] Law enforcement did not secure the scene of the crime.
In fact, there was a dance scheduled for 7:00 p.m. that evening,
and the ballroom was cleaned up and prepared for the dance, which went on as scheduled,
translation.ko: 그래서 볼룸을 청소하고 무도회는 예정대로 진행됐어요

translation.en: with the bullets probably still in the wall.
It made the process of the investigation
seem haphazard at best, botched, at worst.
translation.ko: 좋게 보면 무계획 나쁘게 보면 대실패로 보였죠

translation.en: Maybe convenient to someone?
It's just one of the reasons why many people
translation.ko: 이런 이유 때문에 지금까지도 수많은 사람들이

translation.en: have continued questions about the assassination
translation.ko: 지금까지도 수많은 사람들이 이 사건에서의 암살과 사법당국의 역할에 대해

translation.en: and the role of law enforcement,
translation.ko: 이 사건에서의 암살과 사법당국의 역할에 대해

translation.en: either actively or passively, in this happening.
translation.ko: 적극적으로든 소극적으로든 계속 의문을 갖는 겁니다

translation.en: [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] Did people know it was coming?
Did they get the right guys?
There was just so many stones still unturned.
translation.ko: 아직도 조사해야 할 부분이 너무 많죠

translation.en: And it just kept bugging me and bugging me.
Somewhere in my path,
I decided that I need to drill down on Malcolm's case.
My initial research began in the FBI Hoover building.
translation.ko: 초반 조사는 FBI 본부인 후버 빌딩에서 시작했어요

translation.en: I've gone through the files in the Library of Congress.
You know, anything that I could get my hands on
translation.ko: 접근할 수 있는 자료는 다 뒤졌어요

translation.en: to get clues as to who is responsible for this horrific crime.
translation.ko: 이 끔찍한 범죄의 진범에 대한 실마리를 얻기 위해서였죠

translation.en: But I've never seen the District Attorney's case files
translation.ko: 하지만 검사의 사건 기록 파일은 본 적 없죠

translation.en: or any evidence from the crime scene.
[Lorenzini] So, we have a number of collections
translation.ko: "뉴욕시 기록 보관소" 맬컴 X와 그 암살에 관련된 수집품과 기록은 많이 있습니다

translation.en: at the Archives related to Malcolm X and the assassination of Malcolm X.
translation.ko: 맬컴 X와 그 암살에 관련된 수집품과 기록은 많이 있습니다

translation.en: -There's the DA's case files. -[Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] Okay.
[Lorenzini] Homicide case files, and then there's the NYPD photograph collection.
translation.ko: 강력계 사건 파일에 뉴욕 경찰 사진 기록도 있어요

translation.en: If we look in here,
this is the NYPD Photo Unit Manhattan's logbook.
translation.ko: 뉴욕 경찰 촬영 기록팀의 근무 일지죠

translation.en: [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] So this book would have been at the, uh, precinct.
[Lorenzini] This would have been at the precinct.
Every time an officer comes on duty, they sign in, they sign out,
um, they get a call.
And then you see here, at 3:45.
[Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] 3:45 is when the call was made. [Lorenzini] To the Audubon Ballroom,
"to photograph scene where Malcolm X Little,
translation.ko: 현장을 찍으러 출동했군요 맬컴 X 리틀, 흑인 남성, 39세

translation.en: male Negro, 39,
was allegedly shot by unknown perpetrators.
translation.ko: 신원 불명의 침입자들에 의해 총을 맞았다고 함

translation.en: Photos of ballroom and surrounding area taken
translation.ko: 볼룸과 그 주변 사진은 흑백과 컬러 사진으로 찍었네요

translation.en: in black and white and color," which is very rare.
translation.ko: 볼룸과 그 주변 사진은 흑백과 컬러 사진으로 찍었네요 매우 드문 경우죠

translation.en: Very rare for them to shoot color. [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] Do those exist?
translation.ko: - 컬러 사진 촬영요 - 컬러 사진도 있었어요?

translation.en: [Lorenzini] Those color photographs do exist.
And here's some copies of what...
-[Muhammad] Wow. -Of those.
So here we have backstage at the ballroom.
So there's the stage of the ballroom.
And you can see where they've circled here.
All those chalk marks, those are bullet holes.
[Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] That is incredible.
[Lorenzini] This is the stairwell.
Some of the assailants ran out the back stairwell.
Um, I think there's something like 65 photographs of this scene.
So was there a lot of evidence collected at the scene?
[Lorenzini] There was. What we have is what's in the New York DA's case files.
translation.ko: 많았죠, 저희가 소장한 건 뉴욕 검찰의 사건 파일이에요

translation.en: So now that the DA has turned this over to your office,
translation.ko: 그러면 검찰이 여기로 사건 파일을 보냈으니

translation.en: is it now considered a closed case?
Anything that the DA's office turns over to us
would normally be considered a closed case file.
Um, but that doesn't mean that cases still can't get reopened.
translation.ko: 그렇다고 해서 해당 사건을 재수사할 수 없는 건 아녜요

translation.en: [Muhammad] Well, there's no statute of limitations
-on murder. -Right. [Muhammad] If, for example, this case could be reopened...
[Lorenzini] Right.
...it's quite probable that this material
-would be utilized in it. -Yeah, that's true.
You know, could always be reopened. [Muhammad] Can always be reopened.
[Lorenzini] And that's evidence, not just history.
[reporter] Did he ever discuss with you
the likelihood that he would be assassinated?
[Shabazz] Uh, yes, we discussed it many times.
Several attempts had been made on his life.
The police and the press tried to make it look
translation.ko: 경찰과 언론에서는 집에 폭탄이 터진 게

translation.en: like he bombed his own home, which was ridiculous.
translation.ko: 남편의 자작극이라고 했지만 말도 안 돼요

translation.en: I mean, he had no insurance on the furniture
translation.ko: 남편은 가구나 자기 목숨에 대해 보험 같은 걸

translation.en: or himself, or anything like that,
and now I guess they'll say he shot himself.
[police chief] We're in the process now of trying
to interview every person who was in the ballroom
and get as much information as we can
to find the killers of Malcolm X.
[Stern] The assignment for the police
was to interview every single person that they could identify.
translation.ko: 신원을 알 수 있는 이들 모두와 면담하는 것이었죠

translation.en: "Who'd you sit next to? Who'd you sit next to?
Who did you know? Who did you see?"
[reporter] Did you see what happened, sir?
[witness 1] No, I just came in when it happened.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 갔을 땐 일 터진 뒤였습니다 보이는 거라곤

translation.en: All I could see was smoke and shooting.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 갔을 땐 일 터진 뒤였습니다 보이는 거라곤 총격 후 연기뿐이었죠

translation.en: [reporter] Did you see what happened, dear? [witness 2] No, no, no. No.
[witness 3] I see two men rush up in to the platform.
[Stern] They knew almost nobody to start with.
And then they began to find names as they went through.
I mean, it wasn't Sherlock Holmes, you know?
"Who did you see?
Did you recognize anybody?" Some people did.
[witness 4] There were two fellas.
One was a Black Muslim. Ran and start shooting.
translation.ko: 남자 2명이었는데 1명은 블랙 무슬림이었어요 - 달려가 총을 쐈죠 - 블랙 무슬림요?

translation.en: -They were Black Muslims? -[witness 4] Yes, sir.
translation.ko: - 달려가 총을 쐈죠 - 블랙 무슬림요? 네, 블랙 무슬림이었어요 알아볼 수 있었죠

translation.en: They were Black Muslims 'cause I recognized them.
translation.ko: 네, 블랙 무슬림이었어요 알아볼 수 있었죠

translation.en: [Aziz] The day of the murder, which was a Sunday morning,
I was laying across the couch, with my foot up,
translation.ko: 전 다리를 올린 채 소파에 누워 있었어요

translation.en: and I heard it over the radio.
[news anchor] Breaking news out of New York City. Four bullets from an assassin's gun
have taken the life of black nationalist leader Malcolm X.
translation.ko: 흑인 민족주의 지도자 맬컴 X가 사망했습니다

translation.en: [Aziz] Four days later, they came and got me.
The fact is I spent 20 years in prison for a crime that I didn't commit.
[reporter] Watch the wire, watch the wire.
Has he signed a statement, sir?
[Zak A. Kondo] On February the 26th,
Norman 3X Butler, who is a lieutenant,
he's arrested. And then on March the 3rd,
Thomas 15X Johnson is arrested.
[police chief] We were able to arrest a third suspect this afternoon
translation.ko: 오늘 오후에 맬컴 X 암살의 3번째 용의자를

translation.en: in the assassination of Malcolm X.
He's going to be charged with acting in concert with the others now arrested.
[Stern] These people who were members of the Nation of Islam,
translation.ko: 셋 다 네이션 오브 이슬람 조직원이었죠

translation.en: they were an extremely militant faction.
[Muhammad] Butler and Johnson were from the Harlem mosque,
Mosque number 7, Malcolm's mosque.
From the very beginning, the focus of the investigation was on Harlem,
and on Butler and Johnson.
Because they were known enforcers in the community
who had been arrested for other crimes,
and they were the prime suspects.
[Aziz] I was always one of those few out front.
So the police officers came to us,
because we were all, in effect, on their radar.
But that doesn't mean that we had anything to do with anything.
translation.ko: 그거로 우리가 암살자라고 단정하면 안 돼요

translation.en: 'Cause actually, we didn't.
[Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] The only thing they had was very contradictory eyewitness testimony.
That's all they had. There was no physical evidence to speak of.
translation.ko: 그게 다였죠 물리적 증거 같은 건 없었어요

translation.en: [Tony Bouza] I thought it was a failure.
I thought it was mishandled from beginning to end.
The NYPD had a few shooters
translation.ko: 저격수 몇 명을 잡은 뉴욕 경찰은

translation.en: and they were relieved, as we all were,
uh, to death, relieved to death.
translation.ko: "토니 부자 전 NYPD 소속 형사" 완전히 마음을 푹 놓았어요

translation.en: If I'd been chief, it would have been different.
Uh, that's not the way I worked.
If you get the shooters, you better get the guy who sent them.
translation.ko: 저격범을 잡은 뒤엔 사주한 놈을 잡아야 한다고요

translation.en: [Kondo] Initially, after talking to witnesses,
the NYPD let it be known, and accurately, I should say,
translation.ko: 뉴욕 경찰에서 정말 정확하게 이렇게 말했죠

translation.en: they were seeking five killers,
that there were five men who were part of this team,
and they were searching Harlem, and other places, looking for them.
But after they got Butler, Johnson, and Hayer,
translation.ko: 그러다 버틀러, 존슨과 헤이어를 체포한 뒤

translation.en: the NYPD said, "Case is closed."
[Stern] We locked up Butler and Johnson in a matter of a couple of weeks,
which was quite a feat.
[interviewer] But is it possible that you arrested the wrong guys?
translation.ko: 하지만 체포된 이들이 누명을 썼을 가능성은 없나요?

translation.en: Uh, why would you ask me a question like that?
How can any human being answer a question like that?
translation.ko: 그런 질문에 대답할 수 있는 인간이 있을까요?

translation.en: They were proven guilty beyond a reasonable doubt.
translation.ko: 그들은 의심의 여지 없이 유죄로 입증됐어요

translation.en: Are you going to say it's not possible?
You going to say that? If I put you on the camera, are you going to say that?
translation.ko: 그런데 누명 가능성이라고요? 당신을 카메라로 찍는다면 대답하겠어요?

translation.en: You're not going to say that?
Answer me, you gonna say that?
Okay, then we're in the same boat.
[Sinnette] When Malcolm was killed,
people were just torn apart by what had happened.
[reporter] What did Malcolm X mean to you?
He's a hero to me. He stood out among all black people.
He showed the white man where it was at. [woman] That's right.
[woman 2] He meant a great deal to me and my people.
translation.ko: 날 비롯한 흑인들에겐 정말 의미가 커요

translation.en: I couldn't have cried any more, I don't believe, if I had lost my mother.
translation.ko: 우리 엄마가 돌아가셔도 이보다 더 울 순 없을 거예요

translation.en: [Bailey] Sister Betty asked me to be a pallbearer,
translation.ko: 베티 자매가 나한테 관 운구를 부탁했어요

translation.en: and at that time,
I was feeling very full of grief.
translation.ko: 당시에는 정말이지 슬퍼서 죽을 거 같았죠

translation.en: Unlike any that I had ever felt before or since.
translation.ko: 그런 느낌은 이전에도 이후에도 받은 적 없어요

translation.en: [reporter] And you're saying that you believe this was paid for by whites?
[man] Yeah, by white people.
Any time a black man in this country stands up for his constitutional rights, he dies.
translation.ko: 이 나라에선 헌법상의 권리를 주장하는 흑인은 다 죽어요

translation.en: [woman] I know it wasn't no accident from what I hear Malcolm X say the other night.
translation.ko: 맬컴 X가 전에 하신 얘기가 있으니 사고가 아니라고 봐요

translation.en: [reporter] Who do you believe is responsible?
translation.ko: 맬컴 X를 죽인 건 누구라고 생각하나요?

translation.en: The white power structure in America is behind it.
And they're quick to capitalize on it by saying that, uh,
translation.ko: 재빨리 같은 흑인이 죽인 거라고 떠들고 있잖아요

translation.en: one of his own kind did it, but they put it up to be done.
translation.ko: 재빨리 같은 흑인이 죽인 거라고 떠들고 있잖아요 하지만 배후는 그들이에요

translation.en: [Bilal] All of us was thinking then
that the hidden hand behind Malcolm's assassination
was the big boys down in Washington,
but that maybe members of the Nation of Islam
translation.ko: 하지만 방아쇠는 네이션 오브 이슬람 조직원들이 당겼을 겁니다

translation.en: probably were the trigger men.
translation.ko: 방아쇠는 네이션 오브 이슬람 조직원들이 당겼을 겁니다

translation.en: [news anchor] Malcolm X's pallbearers vow vengeance
translation.ko: 맬컴 X의 관 운구자들이 복수를 다짐합니다

translation.en: on the Black Muslims' leader, Elijah Muhammad.
translation.ko: 상대는 블랙 무슬림의 지도자 일라이자 무함마드죠

translation.en: They feel it is he that ordered Malcolm's execution.
translation.ko: 이들은 그가 맬컴의 처형을 명령했다고 봅니다

translation.en: [reporter] What's going to happen now, you think?
translation.ko: 이제 무슨 일이 벌어질까요? 어떻게 되겠냐고요?

translation.en: It's gonna be a whole lot of hurting before this whole thing is over. That's what I think.
translation.ko: 피바람이 몰아친 뒤에야 사태가 진정될 겁니다

translation.en: -[reporter] Because of his death? -Because of his death, whoever did it,
translation.ko: - 이유는... - 이번 암살이죠 범인이 블랙 무슬림이든 누구든 피바람이 불 거예요

translation.en: Muslims or whoever, there's gonna be a whole lot of hurtin'.
translation.ko: 범인이 블랙 무슬림이든 누구든 피바람이 불 거예요

translation.en: [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] But Malcolm's followers
wanted to take some heads, okay?
translation.ko: 맬컴의 추종자들은 피를 원했죠 복수를 원했어요

translation.en: They want revenge.
[news anchor] Two days after the murder of Malcolm X,
an explosion destroyed the Muslim mosque in Harlem
in what appeared to be the first act of retribution for the murder.
translation.ko: 맬컴의 암살에 대한 첫 번째 응징으로 보입니다

translation.en: Elijah Muhammad himself is said to be a marked man,
with followers of Malcolm X swearing vengeance.
If you would like to follow anyone against me,
translation.ko: 날 버리고 어느 쪽이든 따라가고 싶다면 "일라이자 무함마드"

translation.en: go ahead and do it, but I fear for you.
[news anchor] The South Side Chicago home of Elijah Muhammad
translation.ko: 시카고 남부에 있는 일라이자 무함마드의 집은

translation.en: was under heavy police guard today.
Squad cars were posted at the front and rear.
All who sought entrance to the house
were frisked by Muhammad's own guard force,
translation.ko: 집에 들어가는 사람마다 몸수색한 건 무함마드의 자체 경호원으로

translation.en: the group of husky young Negroes known as the Fruit of Islam.
translation.ko: '프루트 오브 이슬람'으로 알려진 건장한 젊은 흑인 무리입니다

translation.en: [John Ali] This is the house that the Messenger built.
That was their living room there.
That was his bedroom there.
translation.ko: 저기는 침실이고요 "존 알리 네이션 오브 이슬람 전 총무"

translation.en: And his secretaries worked on the third floor and those were his offices there.
I lived here for nine months, when I came to Chicago.
translation.ko: 시카고에 왔을 때 저는 여기서 9개월간 살았죠

translation.en: On the third floor in the back, there was an apartment back there.
I was the secretary of New York.
Until the Honorable Elijah Muhammad brought me here to Chicago in 1960.
[news anchor] Meeting with reporters in his living room,
Muhammad had this evaluation of Malcolm X's killing.
translation.ko: 맬컴 X의 암살에 대한 생각을 밝혔습니다

translation.en: Malcolm, uh, is the victim of his own preaching.
He preached violence, and so he become the victim of it.
translation.ko: 폭력을 장려하다 결국 폭력의 희생양이 됐죠

translation.en: [reporter] Well, Malcolm X said that the Black Muslims were trying to kill him,
translation.ko: 맬컴 X는 블랙 무슬림이 자기를 죽이려 한다면서

translation.en: and he was going to name those
translation.ko: 그런 짓을 저지를 것으로 예상되는 이들의 이름을

translation.en: he thought would commit the crime yesterday
translation.ko: 그런 짓을 저지를 것으로 예상되는 이들의 이름을 어제 밝힐 예정이었습니다 어떻게 생각하시나요?

translation.en: before he was shot. Could you comment on that?
I wasn't there, but I don't believe that any of my followers was there.
translation.ko: 현장에 있진 않았지만 내 추종자 중 누구도

translation.en: They had nothing to do with it at all.
It was predicted that they would blame the Nation of Islam.
translation.ko: 네이션 오브 이슬람 탓으로 돌릴 거 같았죠

translation.en: Elijah Muhammad even said that.
[news anchor] Elijah Muhammad and his followers claim innocence
in the execution of their most famous defector, Malcolm X.
translation.ko: 배신자 맬컴 X의 암살과 무관하다고 주장했습니다

translation.en: [Khalilah Ali] Elijah Muhammad told everybody,
"My believers, do not lay a hand on our brother, Malcolm X,
translation.ko: '신도들이여, 우리의 형제 맬컴 X에게 손대지 마라'

translation.en: because he is not aware of what he is doing.
translation.ko: '그는 자신이 하는 일을 알지 못하고 있다'

translation.en: Give him time. Do not raise a hand against Malcolm X."
translation.ko: '시간을 줘라 맬컴 X를 치려 하지 마라'

translation.en: He said that in the temple. I was there.
I said to the government of America, we are a peaceful people.
We have always tried to obey the law.
We do that. I teach my followers to do it.
[Akbar Muhammad] His words were, "Leave Malcolm alone,"
translation.ko: - 맬컴을 그냥 두라고 하셨죠 - 다시 말하지만...

translation.en: to all of his ministers and to all of us,
translation.ko: 자기 밑의 지도자들과 우리 모두에게 말하셨어요

translation.en: "Leave Malcolm alone."
And those who loved him and obeyed him,
translation.ko: "아크바르 무함마드" 그리고 일라이자를 사랑하고 순종했던 이들은 그 말을 따랐죠

translation.en: that's exactly what they did.
translation.ko: 그리고 일라이자를 사랑하고 순종했던 이들은 그 말을 따랐죠

translation.en: [John Ali] You don't have lentil soup today?
-[waiter] Lentil soup? -[John Ali] Yes.
[waiter] We do have it but we don't put it on the buffet.
If you want to have it, we can get it for you, one order.
-It's a lentil soup? -Yes.
[waiter] Okay, I'll get it when you sit at the table.
translation.ko: 네, 갖다 드릴 테니 앉아 계세요

translation.en: [John Ali] The lentil and the navy bean we eat,
but not the lima beans or black-eyed peas.
This is what the Messenger teaches.
[waiter] This is fresh tandoori chicken from the clay oven.
[John Ali] I had it before. It's okay. [waiter] You've had it before? Okay.
translation.ko: - 전에 먹어 봐서 알아요 - 그래요? 네

translation.en: [interviewer] Did you play a part in having Malcolm get killed?
I could have, if I wanted to.
[waiter] This is a lentil soup, the yellow color.
[John Ali] You can put it right there.
But I don't know who killed him.
I know the Messenger didn't. I know I didn't order it, you know?
translation.ko: 무함마드나 내가 명령한 게 아니란 건 확실하죠

translation.en: Nobody from the FBI or local authorities,
they never asked us anything about it.
They've written in the papers
that we ordered for Malcolm to be killed,
But we didn't.
You know, The Honorable Elijah Muhammad was a wise man.
That he wouldn't do such a stupid thing
as to order someone, you know, to be killed,
translation.ko: 그런 멍청한 짓을 하실 분이 아녜요

translation.en: Malcolm or anyone else.
If it hadn't been for the Messenger saying, "Leave him alone,"
translation.ko: 그분이 맬컴을 그냥 내버려 두라고 안 했다면

translation.en: then he would have been killed,
sooner than he was.
[Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] The key to understanding Malcolm's case
is that from the very beginning,
no one in the power structure gave a damn about what happened.
translation.ko: 권력 구조상의 누구도 이 사건에 신경을 전혀 안 썼다는 사실입니다

translation.en: His assassination was widely reported in the media, especially the white media.
translation.ko: 맬컴의 암살은 특히 백인 언론에서 널리 보도했죠

translation.en: But there was almost a sense that they were gloating.
A sense of glee that he had it coming,
translation.ko: 맬컴이 죽음을 자초했다며 신이 난 어조였죠

translation.en: like he almost deserved this.
[Garrow] It's clear, even in the New York Times
in February of 1965,
that white authorities and most white newsmen
didn't take this killing all that seriously.
translation.ko: 이 암살을 그렇게 심각하게 받아들이지 않았어요

translation.en: That from their perspective, it's some intra-gang warfare
translation.ko: 그들의 관점에서 보면 과격한 흑인 극단주의자들 사이에 벌어진

translation.en: among radical black extremists,
translation.ko: 갱 내부 싸움에 불과했죠 "맬컴 X 살아서도 죽어서도 폭력의 중심"

translation.en: that they don't value what Malcolm's life represented.
translation.ko: "맬컴 X 살아서도 죽어서도 폭력의 중심" 맬컴의 삶이 상징하는 가치를 인정하지 않았어요

translation.en: But the real bottom line to everything we have here
translation.ko: 하지만 지금 우리가 아는 것의 진정한 핵심은

translation.en: is that white prosecution authorities
have never, across this entire chunk of time,
translation.ko: 이 오랜 시간이 흐르는 동안 단 한 번도

translation.en: decades of time,
taken a serious interest
in investigating, pursuing, solving Malcolm's murder.
translation.ko: 맬컴의 암살을 수사하고 해결하는 일에 진지하게 임한 적이 없다는 사실입니다

translation.en: For Abdur-Rahman Muhammad, this has been a very lonely crusade.
translation.ko: 압두르라흐만 무함마드에게 이건 정말 외로운 성전이었죠

translation.en: Because time and again, he's had people who have some initial interest,
and again and again, they've decided not to go forward.
But Abdur-Rahman has never given up. He's still on the case.
translation.ko: 하지만 압두르라흐만은 포기하지 않고 아직 쫓고 있죠

translation.en: [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] After I became a Muslim,
I started moving in certain circles,
and over the years,
I started meeting people who knew things about the assassination.
translation.ko: 암살에 대해 아는 사람들을 만나기 시작했어요

translation.en: You know, who could talk firsthand about it.
translation.ko: 직접 그 얘기를 할 수 있는 사람들요

translation.en: I was like one or two people removed
from actually being able to get certain information!
translation.ko: 특정 정보를 직접적으로 얻을 수 없었거든요

translation.en: [Imam] You are sitting in a place that, in its history,
from the Nation of Islam under the Honorable Elijah Muhammad,
translation.ko: 네이션 오브 이슬람의 영예로운 일라이자 무함마드가

translation.en: that when he started... [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] That's when I realized that
"Hey, if I started asking the right questions,
I could get some very significant answers."
translation.ko: 의미 있는 답변을 얻을 수 있다는 거요

translation.en: And if you were commanded to, you had to have a card in your pocket.
translation.ko: 명령을 받았다면 주머니에 카드가 있었을 겁니다

translation.en: [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] But one of the things that you learn quickly,
is you can't ask a question too directly.
translation.ko: 너무 직접적인 질문은 하면 안 돼요

translation.en: If you ask a question too directly, you could be suspect, you know.
translation.ko: 너무 직접적인 질문을 하면 의심받을 수도 있죠

translation.en: Because then the question would become, "Why are you asking that, brother?"
translation.ko: 왜 그런 질문을 하는지 물을 테니까요

translation.en: When Malcolm first got here,
was there any inkling
or any idea that maybe he was having a problem
translation.ko: 위대하신 일라이자 무함마드와 문제가 있다는 기미 같은 게 있었나요?

translation.en: with the Honorable Elijah Muhammad?
translation.ko: 문제가 있다는 기미 같은 게 있었나요?

translation.en: Or, uh, 'cause I know '63...
Once I would learn something and I would file it away,
translation.ko: 뭔가를 알게 되면 잘 정리해 두면서 떨어진 점들을 연결해 나갔어요

translation.en: and I'd connect this dot with that dot,
translation.ko: 잘 정리해 두면서 떨어진 점들을 연결해 나갔어요

translation.en: or at least be pointed in a certain direction.
translation.ko: 적어도 방향 정도는 잡을 수 있게 됐죠

translation.en: You know, and it became more and more apparent to me
that if anybody could break it, it would be me.
translation.ko: 이 사건을 해결할 사람은 나라는 게요

translation.en: Most serious historians believe
there were five men who were the actual assassins.
According to my research,
I believe those assassins didn't come from Harlem as the police claimed.
translation.ko: 그 암살자들은 경찰 주장과 달리 할렘 출신이 아녜요

translation.en: And I also believe that something has been covered up.
translation.ko: 또한 이 사건에는 은폐된 부분이 있어요

translation.en: We have at least one FBI document
that gives a... you know, a perfect description
translation.ko: 최소한 1개 이상의 FBI 문서가 그 산탄총을 쐈다는 남자를

translation.en: of the man that they say fired the shotgun.
They described him to a tee.
Burly, big, dark-skinned man wearing a certain kind of coat.
translation.ko: 크고 건장한 체구에 피부색이 어두운 남자 코트 색깔까지 명시했어요

translation.en: Complete opposite of the man they convicted.
So someone in the government must have known
that they might be convicting the wrong person, and they let it happen.
translation.ko: 잘못된 사람을 잡아넣은 걸 알고도 내버려 뒀단 거죠

translation.en: And I think that it's only by looking deeply into Malcolm's life
that the clues as to who actually killed him,
translation.ko: 실제로 죽인 자는 누군지 누가 미리 알고 있었는지

translation.en: and who knew it was coming, can be found.
[woman] You are not only honoring Malcolm in the sunshine,
but in the rain.
And the prayer is that
you're not only honoring him on his birthday,
translation.ko: 맬컴의 생일에만 그를 기릴 것이 아니라

translation.en: but every day with the work that you do.
translation.ko: 매일 여러분이 하는 일로 그를 기리시길 바랍니다

translation.en: In the name of el-Hajj Malik el-Shabazz,
in the name of freedom, and black liberation.
Because that is how we truly honor Malcolm.
translation.ko: 그것이 우리가 진정 맬컴을 기리는 방법이니까요

translation.en: [Abdur-Rahman Muhammad] When we say we love Malcolm X,
translation.ko: 우리는 맬컴 X 엘 하즈-말리크 엘 샤바즈를

translation.en: el-Hajj Malik el-Shabazz,
we love him so much, we name high schools and institutions after him.
translation.ko: 얼마나 좋아하면 그의 이름을 따서 학교와 각종 기관을 세울 정도죠

translation.en: He's one of our greatest heroes.
[Malcolm X] You don't scare Negroes today
with no badge, or no white skin, or no white sheet,
or no white anything else.
[Muhammad] Yet the real killers,
the real culprits,
both those who actually fired the trigger,
and those who were, let's say, the puppet masters of the whole thing,
translation.ko: 이 모든 걸 꼭두각시처럼 조종한 사람들은

translation.en: were never brought to justice.
But if you can't prove that a democracy is not hypocrisy,
translation.ko: 하지만 민주주의가 위선이 아니란 걸 입증할 수 없다면

translation.en: then don't put your hands on me.
[Muhammad] There's no statute of limitations on murder.
Yes!
[Muhammad] There's no reason why this case cannot be looked at again.
translation.ko: 이 사건을 재조사하지 않을 이유가 없죠

translation.en: That is my mission. That is my purpose.
translation.ko: 무덤에 서서... 그게 내 임무예요 내 목적이죠

translation.en: As long as someone is still out there,
you know, there is a chance, still,
to get justice for Malcolm.
